body.title: Cancel a Safe and Well Booking

items.title: Please specify why you need to cancel this Safe and Well visit

choices.title: Didn't know I had been referred
Mobilised to incident whilst at SAW

items.text: Details required prior to the assessment
The Safe and Well Report ID

items.title: What is the type of the property?
How many people live in this property?
Smoking - Careless use or disposal of smoking materials?
Is there a chip pan in use?
Is the toaster sited under kitchen units?
Are electrical devices unfit for purpose?
Are electrical devices being used unsafely?
Are there any missing internal doors?
Are there any trip hazards e.g. rugs, cables etc?
How many smoke detectors are fitted and working?
How many smoke detectors have been fitted during the visit?

items.text: Did you fit any other safety equipment?

choices.title: Hearing impaired strobe and vibrating pad

items.title: Is there a risk of cold homes? (tick all that apply)?

choices.title: Not using heating/living in a cold home
Central heating fitted, but other heating methods used

items.title: Cold homes advice given? (tick all that apply)

choices.title: Not using heating/living in a cold home
Central heating fitted, but other heating methods used

items.title: Household referred for cold homes advice or services?
Is there evidence of poor home security?

choices.title: Outside the home e.g. fences, bushes, sheds

choices.title: Outside the home e.g. fences, bushes, sheds

items.title: Does anyone in the household own or have access to a vehicle?
For car, and van drivers and motorcyclists was advice given on the fatal four?
For car, van drivers, cyclists and motorcyclists was advice given on PPE and use of helmets?
For car, van drivers, cyclists and motorcyclists was advice given on tyre depth and pressures?
Have you discussed pedestrian safety info in booklet?
Is there a CO detector in the property?
Was general advice given about CO?
Was there action taken as a result of the CO reading?

choices.title: 1 - I do not feel safe at all

choices.title: Yes - Occupier would be slow to vacate the property (wheelchair/walking stick etc)
Yes - Occupier will require assistance to vacate the property (e.g. bed bound)
Yes - Occupier will require assistance and specialist tech rescue equipment (e.g. Barriatric)

items.title: What method of falls assessment will be used?
Get up and go booklet left?
FRAT - Is there a history of falls in the previous year?
FRAT - is the person on 4 or more medications per day?
FRAT - Does the person have a diagnosis of stroke or parkinsons?
FRAT - Does the person report any problems with their balance?
FRAT - Is the person UNABLE to rise from a chair at knee height without using their arms?
Which of the following best describes your gender?
Do you have a disability, long term illness, or health condition? (Tick all that apply)

choices.title: Mobility e.g. difficulty walking short distances or climbing stairs

items.title: Do you receive care and support? (formal or informal)
Do you receive means tested benefits?
Do you take 4 or more medications per day?
Have you had a medication review in the last 6 months?
Did you recommend that they contact their GP to arrange a medication review?
Is there any evidence of drug or alcohol dependence?
Are you long-term 'not in work' (12 months+) or have never worked?
Did you offer advice about the benefits of volunteering and training as a route into employment?
Do you feel safe in your home now?

choices.title: 1 - I do not feel safe at all

items.title: How likely are you to recommend our Safe & Well visit to friends and family?
Please choose which you think best describes our Safe & Well visit
Please select areas you would like to be involved in, or receive more information about

items.text: Crews will arrive within the time slot booked and the visit will take approximately 45 minutes to complete from the time of arrival

body.title: Would you like to use a security password to give to crews when they arrive?
Please enter a security password for your visit
If you have a keysafe code to share with us please type it below

body.text:
West Midlands Fire Service has a duty to promote fire safety and this is achieved by providing advice, education and community safety interventions to reduce the incidences of fires. We provide advice on fire safety in the home and this done during a Safe & Well visit. 

During a Safe & Well visit, we will collect information including your name, date of birth, ethnicity, along with information about your risk and vulnerability to fire which often includes details about your property, lifestyle and health and wellbeing. We will use this to help you to reduce the risk of fire and to help you understand what you should do if a fire occurs 

We recognise that information we collect about you, particularly that about yourhealthand wellbeing is more sensitive. We only collect the minimum amount that enables us to effectively assess all risk factors that might make you more vulnerable to fire and other incidents in your home. 

We work closely with other organisations who may be able to assist you further in reducing your risk and vulnerability and provide help such as falls prevention or smoking cessation. We will explain if and why we want to share your information with these agencies 

Any information that would indicate a risk to life or property that is collected during a Safe & Well visit may be used by operational personnel during an incident, helping to protect life and property. 

The Equality Act 2010 places a duty on WMFS to serve all communities equally and to the highest standards in line with the Fire and rescue Service Equality and Diversity Strategy. This is why we collect information about your ethnic origin. 

West Midlands Fire Service is required by law to make contact with other agencies, usually relating to crime or where there is a serious risk to personal safety, abuse or neglect and we feel that making a safeguarding referral to Adult or Childrens Services is appropriate. 

This information is kept by us for as long as it is needed to help prevent death or injury by fire. 

For further information on how your information is used, how we maintain the security of your information and your rights to access information we hold on you, please contact: 

The Data Protection Officer 
West Midlands Fire Service 
99 Vauxhall Road, Birmingham 
B7 4HW

choices.title: Show referrals with and without incidents

items.text: Use this section to provide details of the person who you are arranging a SAW visit for. Please be sure to discuss the Privacy Notice with the recipient before continuing.

body.text: West Midlands Fire Service has a duty to promote fire safety and this is achieved by providing advice, education and community safety interventions to reduce the incidences of fires. We provide advice on fire safety in the home and this done during a Safe & Well visit. </br></br>During a Safe & Well visit, we will collect information including your name, date of birth, ethnicity, along with information about your risk and vulnerability to fire which often includes details about your property, lifestyle and health and wellbeing. We will use this to help you to reduce the risk of fire and to help you understand what you should do if a fire occurs </br></br>We recognise that information we collect about you, particularly that about yourhealthand wellbeing is more sensitive. We only collect the minimum amount that enables us to effectively assess all risk factors that might make you more vulnerable to fire and other incidents in your home. </br></br>We work closely with other organisations who may be able to assist you further in reducing your risk and vulnerability and provide help such as falls prevention or smoking cessation. We will explain if and why we want to share your information with these agencies </br></br>Any information that would indicate a risk to life or property that is collected during a Safe & Well visit may be used by operational personnel during an incident, helping to protect life and property. </br></br>The Equality Act 2010 places a duty on WMFS to serve all communities equally and to the highest standards in line with the Fire and rescue Service Equality and Diversity Strategy. This is why we collect information about your ethnic origin. </br></br>West Midlands Fire Service is required by law to make contact with other agencies, usually relating to crime or where there is a serious risk to personal safety, abuse or neglect and we feel that making a safeguarding referral to Adult or Childrens Services is appropriate. </br></br>This information is kept by us for as long as it is needed to help prevent death or injury by fire. </br></br>For further information on how your information is used, how we maintain the security of your information and your rights to access information we hold on you, please contact: </br></br>The Data Protection Officer </br>West Midlands Fire Service </br>99 Vauxhall Road, Birmingham </br>B7 4HW

body.text: Use this to collect data from Safe and Strong visits, including commercial hot strikes following an incident, on invitation from commercial premises (either at the time or as planned work).

body.title: Identifies who is doing this activity

items.title: Was this Safe and Strong visit declined?
When did this Safe and Strong visit take place?

body.title: What is the reason for this visit?

items.title: What is the reason for this visit?

choices.title: Because there was an incident in the vicinity

items.text: Assess how likely it is that a fire will break out

Consider Heat, Fuel and Oxygen.

Heat - consider general ignition sources, heat processes, smoking (e.g. Shisha lounge), hot works, arson, etc.

Fuels - consider all classes (A, B, C, D, (E), F) and cleanliness and housekeeping, construction materials, extraction systems, dust explosions, etc.

Oxygen - In the air, in cylinders, in the work process, chemically, etc.)

items.title: What is the likelihood of a fire breaking out?

choices.title: High likelihood of the outbreak of fire
Medium likelihood of the outbreak of fire
Low likelihood of the outbreak of fire

body.title: Advice given to reduce likelihood of Fire

items.title: Advice given to reduce the likelihood of fire

choices.title: Electrical safety of the building (Electricity regs - PIT Testing)
General electrical safety - overloaded sockets, extension leads
Person-centred advice e.g. oxygen user and smoking materials

items.text: Were the safety systems in the premises (preventive and protective measures) sufficient i.e. people are likely to be safe in case of fire.

items.title: The date the audit took place

items.text: The inspector reflects on whether the fire safety at the premises is reasonably assured

items.title: Is the fire safety of the premises reasonably assured?
What is the level of fire safety management at the premises?

High level of fire safety management
Average level of fire safety management
Low level of fire safety management
Very low level of fire safety management

items.text: What was the outcome of the audit?
Tick articles that relate to areas of fire safety failures and that are being enforced.

items.title: A8 (Duty to take general fire precautions)
A10 (Principles of prevention to be applied)
A12 (Elimination or reduction of risks from dangerous substances)
A15 (Procedures for serious and imminent danger and for danger areas)
A16 (Additional emergency measures in respect of dangerous substances)
A20 (Provision of information to employers and the self-employed from outside undertakings)
A24 (Power to make regulations about fire precautions)
A38 (Maintenance of measures provided for protection of fire fighters)

items.text: Hours spent on audit (includes file checking, travel, site visits, research, etc. until safety is achieved and involvement with the premises is ended
